Parameter.Enum values:BRAND:brand.CONTENT_CATEGORY:content_category.CONTENT_ID:content_id.CONTENT_NAME:content_name.CONTENT_TYPE:content_type.CURRENCY:currency.DESCRIPTION:description.EVENT_ID:event_id.NUM_ITEMS:num_items.PRICE:price.SEARCH_STRING:search_string.STATUS:status.URL:url.VALUE:value.

Operator.WhenparameterisBRAND,CONTENT_CATEGORY,CONTENT_ID,CONTENT_NAME,CONTENT_TYPE,DESCRIPTION,EVENT_ID,SEARCH_STRING,STATUS, orURL, the enum values are:CONTAIN: Contains.NOT_CONTAIN: Does not contain.START_WITH: Starts with.EQUAL: Is equal to.NOT_EQUAL: Is not equal to.WhenparameterisNUM_ITEMS,PRICE, orVALUE, the enum values are:EQUAL: Is equal to.NOT_EQUAL: Is not equal to.LT: Is less than.GT: Is greater than.LTE: Is less than or equal to.GTE: Is greater than or equal to.WhenparameterisCURRENCY, the enum values are:EQUAL: Is equal to.NOT_EQUAL: Is not equal to.

Values for the parameter.WhenparameterisBRAND,CONTENT_CATEGORY,CONTENT_ID,CONTENT_NAME,CONTENT_TYPE,DESCRIPTION,EVENT_ID,SEARCH_STRING,STATUS,URL, the field will be an array of strings, each with a maximum length of 100 characters and up to 100 entries.WhenparameterisNUM_ITEMS, the field will be an integer between 0 and 1,000,000,000.WhenparameterisPRICE,VALUE, the field will be a float kept to two decimal places, within the range from 0.00 to 1,000,000,000.00.WhenparameterisCURRENCY, the field will be an array of strings. To learn about the enum values, seeList of currency values.

The time when the Custom Conversion was last updated, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(UTC+0).Example:2025-01-01 00:00:01.

Filtering information that is specified in your request.If you don't include the following parameters in the request, we will return the default values for them, which aredate_range = 7DAY,country_code = US,industry_id = ALL, andcategory_name = ALL.
The timeframe in which the items have been popular.Enum values:1DAY: last 1 day.7DAY: last 7 days.30DAY: last 30 days.120DAY: last 120 days.
Location code.SeeLocation codefor the enum values.Example:DE.
The name of the hashtag industry category.To learn about the enum values, seeHashtag industry category names.Example:FOOD_AND_BEVERAGE.
The list of popular hashtags.
Hashtag ID.Example:4268426520694.
Hashtag name.Example:yummy.
Current rank position of the hashtag among hashtags within the same category (category_name) or industry (industry_id) in the selected region (country_code).Example:100.

The change in rank position compared to the rank in the last time period.A positiverank_changeindicates an increase in rank. For example, if the rank position shifts from 5 to 1,rank_changewill be4.A negativerank_changeindicates a decrease in rank. For example, if the rank position shifts from 1 to 5,rank_changewill be-4.Arank_changeof0indicates no changes in rank.Arank_changemarked asNEWindicates that the hashtag was not present in the top 200 ranking list in the last time period.

The number of views for related videos that feature this hashtag in the selected region and timeframe.Note: If you fail to specifycountry_codeordate_rangein your request, we will return data based on the default values for these two parameters, which aredate_range = 7DAYorcountry_code = US.Example: 134333716.
The number of views for related videos that feature this hashtag, globally and across their whole lifetime.Example: 91639649280.

The number of posts for related videos that feature this hashtag in the selected region and timeframe.Note: If you fail to specifycountry_codeordate_rangein your request, we will return data based on the default values for these two parameters, which aredate_range = 7DAYorcountry_code = US.Example: 21856.
The number of posts for related videos that feature this hashtag, globally and across their whole lifetime.Example: 7846729.

The location codes of the top five locations in the world where this hashtag is most popular.To learn about the location that a location code represents, seeLocation code.Example:["US", "GB", "PH", "CA", "DE"].
The historical ranking data for the hashtag, spanning up to the past 30 days..

The rank position of the hashtag among hashtags across all categories or industries in the selected region (country_code) on the date.Example:73.Note: If the hashtag does not perform well compared to the last time period, the hashtag will not be considered a trending hashtag and the value of this field will be null.

The number of views for related videos that feature this hashtag in the selected region (country_code) on the date.Example: 21215985.Note: If the daily views are less than 1,000, the value of this field will be null.

parameters.description: For web events only.TikTok Click ID, a data connection parameter appended to a landing page URL whenever a user clicks on an ad on TikTok.Thettclidvalid period is the same as your CTA window setting inAttribution Manager.For more information on sending TikTok Click IDs, refer toEvents API 2.0 - Send TikTok Click ID (ttclid).

For web, app, offline, and CRM events.SHA-256 hashing is required.The email address, or email addresses of the customer.Follow the instructions below to obtain a valid value:Trimany leading and trailing spaces of each email before hashing.Lowercaseall characters before hashing.Hashthe normalized email values using SHA-256.Example:Original: " ALICE_abc@gmail.com "Normalized: "alice_abc@gmail.com" (leading and trailing spaces trimmed and lowercased)SHA-256 hashed: "848a771458438fc2ec420560d769fb9b9b86851ee338ec56517baabd79d3bb4f"

For web, app, offline, and CRM events.SHA-256 hashing is required.The phone number or phone numbers of the customer.Follow the instructions below to obtain a valid value:Normalizethe phone number toE.164 format(for example, "+12133734253"). We recommend usinghttps://github.com/catamphetamine/libphonenumber-jsfor E.164 parsing.Country codemust be included and prefixed with the+sign, without any parentheses or leading0s. For example, a US phone number should be prefixed with the+1country code.No spaces, letters or symbolsexcept the+for the country code are included.SHA-256 hashthe phone number after normalizing.Example:Original: "(+1)2133734253"Normalized to E.164 format: "+12133734253"SHA256 hashed: "9f7ec22d72092cd3c0b58726ed9c2d91b92e51a3f29837508fb2948bb22dd2fd"

For web and CRM events only.SHA-256 hashing is required.External ID, a unique identifier on the advertiser's side, such as loyalty membership IDs, user IDs, and external cookie IDs. To learn more about theexternal_idparameter, refer toEvents API 2.0 - Set up External ID.Example:Original: "user_123"SHA-256 hashed: "80fba0ae1c48e3978e43e4efc365e14e12ea0c830ba8ba5b9a2dafc7e3f2ab8b"

For web events only.Cookie ID.If you also use Pixel SDK and have enabled cookies, Pixel SDK automatically saves a unique identifier in the_ttpcookie. The value of_ttpis used to match website visitor events with TikTok ads. You can extract the value of_ttpand attach the value here.To learn more about thettpparameter, refer toEvents API 2.0 - Send TikTok Cookie (_ttp).

For web and app events only.Non-hashedpublic IPaddress of the user's device.To increase the probability of matching website visitor events with TikTok ads, we recommend sending bothipanduser_agent.Both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported. For IPv6 addresses, both full and compressed formats are acceptable.For example:Full format:2001:0db8:1111:000a:00b0:0000:0000:0200Compressed format:2001:db8:1111:a:b0::200
For web and app events only.Non-hashed user agent from the user’s device.To increase the probability of matching website visitor events with TikTok ads, we recommend sending bothipanduser_agent.

The iOS IDFAfor app events only.For iOS 14 and above, ensure that IDFA data collection followsApple’s policies. Both raw and SHA-256 IDFAs are accepted:For raw IDFAs, all characters must beUPPERCASE.For SHA-256 IDFAs, all characters must belowercase, and anyleading/trailing spacesmust betrimmedbefore hashing.
The iOS IDFVfor app events only.

The GAID (Google Advertising ID)for app events only.Both raw and SHA-256 GAIDs are accepted.For both raw and SHA-256 GAIDs:All characters must belowercase.Leading/trailing spacesmust betrimmedbefore hashing
For web and app events only.The BCP 47 language identifier.For reference, refer tothe IETF BCP 47 standardized code.

For app events only.Whether the user has authorized your mobile app to access app-related data for measuring the user or the device. This is an iOS only field.Enum values:AUTHORIZED: The user has authorized access to app-related data that can be used for measuring the user or the device.DENIED: The user has not agreed to authorize your mobile app to access app-related data for measuring the user or the device viaApple's AppTrackingTransparency framework.If this field is set toDENIED, TikTok will not use the PII data (for instance, user email address or phone number) in this App Event for user-level matching.NOT_DETERMINED: The user has not yet received an authorization request to authorize access to app-related data that can be used for measuring the user or the device.RESTRICTED: The authorization to access app-related data is restricted.NOT_APPLICABLE: The iOS version is below 14 or the device is running Android.

Asset relationship status.Enum values:null: The pixel is owned by the advertiser (advertiser_id) and has not been transferred to a Business Center as an asset.TRANSFERRED: The pixel has been transferred to a Business Center as an asset but is still owned by the advertiser (advertiser_id). To transfer a pixel, use/bc/pixel/transfer/.SHARED: The pixel is shared with the advertiser (advertiser_id) as an asset. You can modify a pixel that is shared by others, but you cannot delete it.UNBOUND: The pixel was shared with the advertiser (advertiser_id) as an asset but has been unbound from the advertiser. In reporting data, pixels whose status isUNBOUNDwill not be counted.

Whether the pixel is owned by the advertiser (advertiser_id).Enum values:true,false.If the value ofasset_relation_statusis null orTRANSFERRED, the value of this field will betrue.If the value ofasset_relation_statusisSHAREDorUNBOUND, the value of this field will befalse.

Time when the lastest relationship was formed, in the format of Unix timestamp (for example, 1581679723600).Note: The field is to be deprecated in the next API version, and currently you may not get a valid time via this field.

Secondary status.For enum values, seeSupported campaign secondary statuses for GMV Max Campaigns.

The ROI protection compensation status of the campaign.ROI protection is a feature that automatically issues ad credits when the return on investment (ROI) for your campaign falls below a certain threshold despite following GMV Max guidelines and best practices. To learn about the eligibility criteria for ROI protection and scenarios where the campaign is ineligible for ROI protection, seeAbout ROI protection for GMV Max campaigns.Enum values:IN_EFFECT: ROI protection eligible. This campaign is eligible for an ad credit if your ads drive more than 20 conversions in 24 hours, but your ROI result is less than 90% of your target. To maintain campaign eligibility for ROI protection, don't edit your ROI, pause ad delivery, or enable max delivery. Campaign eligibility resets every 24 hours.NOT_ELIGIBLE: ROI protection ineligible. This campaign isn't eligible for an ad credit if the target ROI isn't met because its ROI has been edited, the campaign has been paused, max delivery is enabled, or there are issues with your shop, ad accounts, livestreams, or products. Campaign eligibility resets every 24 hours.

The target ROI index.Changes to your target ROI will be in effect during promotion days and may drive higher GMV for this campaign.Enum values:90: -10%. To decrease your target ROI by 10% during promotion days.80: -20%. To decrease your target ROI by 20% during promotion days.70: -30%. To decrease your target ROI by 30% during promotion days.
Promotion days target ROI.

The current campaign daily budget.If the budget does not undergo automatic increases, this value matches your specified daily budget (budget).In cases where automatic increases occur, this value will exceed your specified campaign daily budget.

The increase in budget compared with your specified campaign daily budget (budget).For example, ifbudgetis 300 USD andnext_increaseis 150 USD, thencurrent_budgetwill be 450 USD, indicating a daily budget increase of 150 USD.

The maximum potential increase in budget.Formula:maximum_budget=budget+next_increasex 10.For instance, ifbudgetis 200 USD andnext_increaseis 100 USD,maximum_budgetwill be 1200 USD, as the increase can occur up to 10 times daily.
The estimated percentage increase in gross revenue due to the ROI change during promotion days.Example:24%.

Whether to enable automatic budget increase.When your achieved ROI reaches at least 90% of the target and 80% or more of your budget has been used, your daily campaign budget may automatically increase by up to 10 times to capture more sales. Your budget will reset to its original amount each day.Whenis_enabledwithin the objectpromotion_daysistrueandauto_budget_enabledisfalse, your ROI target will decrease and your daily budget will automatically increase during TikTok Shop promotion days (whenauto_schedule_enabledistrue) and custom promotion days as defined bycustom_schedule_list. Your daily budget will reset to its original amount every day. During standard days, your ROI target and budget won't change.Whenis_enabledwithin the objectpromotion_daysistrueandauto_budget_enabledistrue, auto budget increase will be turned on during TikTok Shop promotion days (whenauto_schedule_enabledistrue), custom promotion days as defined bycustom_schedule_list,** and standard days**. Your daily budget will reset to its original amount every day. During TikTok Shop promotion days and custom promotion days as defined bycustom_schedule_list, your ROI target will decrease. During standard days, your ROI target won't change.Whenis_enabledwithin the objectpromotion_daysisfalseandauto_budget_enabledistrue, your ROI won't change, your daily campaign budget may automatically increase up to 10 times to optimize gross revenue. Your daily budget will reset to its original amount every day.Supported values:true,false.
Schedule type.Enum values:SCHEDULE_FROM_NOW: To run the campaign continuously after the scheduled start time.SCHEDULE_START_END: To run the campaign between the scheduled start time and end time.

Optimization goal.Enum value:VALUE: Gross revenue.

Whether the campaign is eligible for ROI protection.ROI protection is a feature that automatically issues ad credits when the return on investment (ROI) for your campaign falls below a certain threshold despite following GMV Max guidelines and best practices. To learn about the eligibility criteria for ROI protection and scenarios where the campaign is ineligible for ROI protection, seeAbout ROI protection for GMV Max campaigns.Supported values:true,false.
Bid strategy.Enum value:VO_MIN_ROAS: Minimum ROAS. Bid with an ROI target.
Returned only whendeep_bid_typeisVO_MIN_ROAS.ROI target.
Daily budget.
The promotion days setting details.

Whether to enable promotion days to automatically optimize your campaign for higher GMV during high-intent shopping dates in regions where your ads are delivering.When promotion days are active for this campaign, your ad credits will be calculated for your promotion days target ROI setting.Supported values:true,false.
Whether to use TikTok Shop promotion days schedule.Supported values:true,false.
Details of the custom promotion day schedules.
The start time of the custom promotion day schedule, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD(ad account time zone).
The end time of the custom promotion day schedule, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD(ad account time zone).

The target ROI index.Changes to your target ROI will be in effect during promotion days and may drive higher GMV for this campaign.Enum values:90: -10%. To decrease your target ROI by 10% during promotion days.80: -20%. To decrease your target ROI by 20% during promotion days.70: -30%. To decrease your target ROI by 30% during promotion days.
Promotion days target ROI.

The current campaign daily budget.If the budget does not undergo automatic increases, this value matches your specified daily budget (budget).In cases where automatic increases occur, this value will exceed your specified campaign daily budget.

The increase in budget compared with your specified campaign daily budget (budget).For example, ifbudgetis 300 USD andnext_increaseis 150 USD, thencurrent_budgetwill be 450 USD, indicating a daily budget increase of 150 USD.

The maximum potential increase in budget.Formula:maximum_budget=budget+next_increasex 10.For instance, ifbudgetis 200 USD andnext_increaseis 100 USD,maximum_budgetwill be 1200 USD, as the increase can occur up to 10 times daily.
The estimated percentage increase in gross revenue due to the ROI change during promotion days.Example:24%.

Whether to enable automatic budget increase.When your achieved ROI reaches at least 90% of the target and 80% or more of your budget has been used, your daily campaign budget may automatically increase by up to 10 times to capture more sales. Your budget will reset to its original amount each day.Whenis_enabledwithin the objectpromotion_daysistrueandauto_budget_enabledisfalse, your ROI target will decrease and your daily budget will automatically increase during TikTok Shop promotion days (whenauto_schedule_enabledistrue) and custom promotion days as defined bycustom_schedule_list. Your daily budget will reset to its original amount every day. During standard days, your ROI target and budget won't change.Whenis_enabledwithin the objectpromotion_daysistrueandauto_budget_enabledistrue, auto budget increase will be turned on during TikTok Shop promotion days (whenauto_schedule_enabledistrue), custom promotion days as defined bycustom_schedule_list,and standard days. Your daily budget will reset to its original amount every day. During TikTok Shop promotion days and custom promotion days as defined bycustom_schedule_list, your ROI target will decrease. During standard days, your ROI target won't change.Whenis_enabledwithin the objectpromotion_daysisfalseandauto_budget_enabledistrue, your ROI won't change, your daily campaign budget may automatically increase up to 10 times to optimize gross revenue. Your daily budget will reset to its original amount every day.Supported values:true,false.
Schedule type.Enum values:SCHEDULE_FROM_NOW: To run the campaign continuously after the scheduled start time.SCHEDULE_START_END: To run the campaign between the scheduled start time and end time.

Recommended ROI target for the optimization goal Groess revenue.The ROI is based on the average ROI for your product category.

Recommended daily budget for the optimization goal Groess revenue, in the currency of the ad account.The budget is calculated with your average ad spend for your selected products or average ad spend in your product category from the previous 14 days. Higher budgets are recommended to ensure delivery throughout the day because lower budgets may spend more quickly and limit your campaign performance.To retrieve the currency of an ad account, use/advertiser/info/and check the returnedcurrency.

parameters.description: Advertiser ID.

The ID of the Product GMV Max Campaign.To create a Product GMV Max Campaign and obtain the campaign ID, use/campaign/gmv_max/create/and setshopping_ads_typetoPRODUCT.To filter existing Product GMV Max Campaigns within your ad account, use/gmv_max/campaign/get/and setfilteringto{"gmv_max_promotion_types":["PRODUCT_GMV_MAX"]}.
The ID of the TikTok Shop.To obtain the ID of the TikTok Shop that is associated with a GMV Max Campaign, use/campaign/gmv_max/info/.
Details about the max delivery mode for the campaign.

The session type.Enum values:NO_BID: max delivery session. Learn aboutthe prerequisites for creating a max delivery session.Default value:NO_BID.Note: To create a creative boost session, seeParameters for creating a creative boost sessionand setbid_typetoCREATIVE_NO_BID.
Details about the specific products.Max size: 1.

The Product SPU (standard product unit) ID.To obtain the list of SPU IDs for products within a TikTok Shop, use/store/product/get/and setad_creation_eligibletoGMV_MAXand selectitem_group_idvalues wherestatusisAVAILABLE.

The daily max delivery budget.Max delivery uses additional budget, separate from target ROI optimization budget, paced for more predictable ad spending. Your target ROI budget won’t be used for products using max delivery while max delivery is active.Value range: ≥ 10 (USD).

Schedule type for max delivery.Enum values:SCHEDULE_FROM_NOW: To enable the max delivery mode for the product continuously after theschedule_start_time, until the campaign scheduled end time.SCHEDULE_START_END: To enable the max delivery mode for the product between theschedule_start_timeandschedule_end_time.Default value:SCHEDULE_FROM_NOW.

The start time for the max delivery mode, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(UTC+0).If not specified, this field will default to the current time.Note:The start time cannot be earlier than the current time.The start time should be later than or equal to the campaign start time.Your daily budget will be spent evenly throughout the day. If your max delivery duration is less than 24 hours in a given day, your full budget will still be spent.Max delivery will be active between your set start and end times for your selected products. If your campaign is still active when max delivery ends, the optimization mode for those products will automatically change to target ROI.

Required whenschedule_typeisSCHEDULE_START_END.Not supported whenschedule_typeisSCHEDULE_FROM_NOW.The end time for the max delivery mode, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(UTC+0).Note:The end time cannot be earlier than the current time.The end time should be earlier or equal to the campaign end time.

This type of identity is created when you bind your TikTok For Business account with your TikTok Business Account, or when you bind your TikTok For Business account with your regular TikTok account and then upgrade the account to Business Account.BC_AUTH_TT: TikTok Account User in Business Center. This type of identity is created when you add a TikTok account to your Business Center, and the TikTok account owner approves your request.TTS_TT: TikTok Account User for TikTok Shop. This type of identity is created when you set an official TikTok account for the TikTok Shop.
Returned only whenidentity_typeisBC_AUTH_TT.The ID of the Business Center that a TikTok Account User in Business Center identity is associated with.
Returned for someBC_AUTH_TTidentities.The ID of the TikTok Shop that the TikTok Account User in Business Center identity is associated with.
Returned only whenidentity_typeisTTS_TT.The ID of the TikTok Shop that a TikTok Account User for TikTok Shop identity is associated with.

Temporary profile image URL for the TikTok account that is associated with the identity.Validity period: around 48 hours. The expiration time is included in the URL after thex-expiresparameter, in the format of an Epoch/Unix timestamp in seconds.Once the URL expires, you need to call/gmv_max/identity/get/to obtain a new URL.
The display name of the TikTok account that is associated with the identity.
The username of the TikTok account that is associated with the identity.
Whether the identity is being used in enabled Video Shopping Ads, Product Shopping Ads or Live Shopping Ads.Supported values:true,false.
Whether the identity is available for use in Product GMV Max Campaigns.Supported values:true,false.
Whether the identity is available for use in LIVE GMV Max Campaigns.Supported values:true,false.

Returned only whenlive_gmv_max_availableisfalse.The reason why the identity is not available for LIVE GMV Max Campaigns.Enum values:OCCUPIED: The identity has been occupied by an enabled LIVE GMV Max Campaign.UNAUTHORIZED: The identity is not authorized for use in LIVE GMV Max Campaigns.

Estimated inventory result.If you have specified a fixed value forpurchased_impression,budgetorpurchased_reachin request, depending on the fixed value you have specified, we will return the corresponding predicted values in thedefault_resultobject in the response.For example, if you setrf_purchased_typetoFIXED_SHOWand specify a fixed value inpurchased_impression, then based on the impressions you set, we will calculate and return the estimated values forbudget,cpm,reachandaverage_frequencyindefault_result.
Basic information.
Total budget.
CPM (Cost per mille).Formula:cpm=budget/impression.
Total impressions,in the unit of 1,000.For example, the value of 110 for this field represents 110,000 impressions.
Number of users reached,in the unit of 1,000.For example, the value of 110 for this field represents 110,000 users reached.

Number of total bookable reach based on the specified feed type, targeting settings and campaign duration,in the unit of 1,000.For example, the value of 200 in this field represents an available inventory of 200,000 users.
Formula: impressions per person (average_frequency) = total impressions  (impression)/ numbers of users reached  (reach).
Daily spend.
Spend for the day.
Date.Format:"YYYY-MM-DD".Example:"2024-01-01".

Distribution of impressions per person.Note: When the frequency cap determined byfrequencyandfrequency_schedulein the request exceeds four times a day, the value for thefrequency_per_personwill remain unchanged.
Impressions per person.
The percentage of users for thefrequency.For example, iffrequencyis1andpercentageis0.42304230423042305, then around 42.3% users will be shown the ad once.

Estimated inventory results for different budgets. In each result, the estimated impression, CPM, reach, frequency, daily cost, and frequency per person will be provided for the budget.The data structure for this object is the same as that ofdefault_result.
Basic information.
Total budget.
CPM (Cost per mille).Formula:cpm=budget/impression.
Total impressions,in the unit of 1,000.For example, the value of 110 for this field represents 110,000 impressions.

Formula: impressions per person (average_frequency) = total impressions  (impression)/ numbers of users reached  (reach).
Daily spend.
Spend for the day.
Date.Format:"YYYY-MM-DD".Example:"2024-01-01".

Distribution of impressions per person.Note: When the frequency cap determined byfrequencyandfrequency_schedulein the request exceeds four times a day, the value for thefrequency_per_personwill remain unchanged.
Impressions per person.
The percentage of users for the frequency.For example, iffrequencyis1andpercentageis0.42304230423042305, then around 42.3% users will be shown the ad once.

Brand safety type for Reach and Frequency ads. Enum values:NO_BRAND_SAFETY:  To not use any brand safety solution.  Full inventory, which means your ads may appear next to some content featuring mature themes.EXPANDED_INVENTORY: Use TikTok's brand safety solution. Expanded inventory means that your ads will appear next to content where most inappropriate content has been removed, and that does not contain mature themes. In the next API version,EXPANDED_INVENTORYwill replaceNO_BRAND_SAFETYand will be the default brand safety option.STANDARD_INVENTORY: Use TikTok's brand safety solution. Standard inventory means that ads will appear next to content that is appropriate for most brands.LIMITED_INVENTORY: Use TikTok's brand safety solution. Limited inventory means that your ads will not appear next to content that contains mature themes.THIRD_PARTY: Use a third-party brand safety solution.To get the countries and regions that your ads can be deployed to based on your brand safety settings, use the/tool/region/endpoint.

Click-through window. This attribution window is the time between when a person clicks your ad and then takes an action.Enum values:OFF: Off.ONE_DAY: 1-day click.SEVEN_DAYS: 7-day click.FOURTEEN_DAYS: 14-day click.TWENTY_EIGHT_DAYS: 28-day click.

Engaged view-through window. This attribution window is the time after someone watches at least 6 seconds of your video ad that a conversion is counted.Enum values:ONE_DAY: 1-day engaged view.SEVEN_DAYS: 7-day engaged view.FOURTEEN_DAYS: 14-day engaged view.TWENTY_EIGHT_DAYS: 28-day engaged view.
View-through window. This attribution window is the time between when a person views your ad and then takes an action.Enum values:OFF: Off.ONE_DAY: 1-day view.SEVEN_DAYS: 7-day view.

Event count (Statistic type).The way that people's actions are counted after only viewing or clicking an ad.Enum values:UNSET: Unset.EVERY: Every. To count multiple events from someone as separate conversions.ONCE: Once. To count multiple events from someone as 1 conversion.

Ad delivery arrangement, in the format of a string that consists of 48 x 7 characters. Each character is mapped to a 30-minute timeframe from Monday to Sunday. Each character can be set to either 0 or 1. 1 represents delivery in the 30-minute timeframe, and 0 stands for non-delivery in the 30-minute timeframe. The first character is mapped to 0:01-0:30 of Monday; The second character is mapped to 0:31-1:00 of Monday, and the last character represents 23:31-0:00 Sunday.Note: Not specified, all-0, or all-1 are considered as full-time delivery.

A list of URL parameters.URL parameters are snippets of code that can be added to the end of the URLs to help you track clicks across different channels and understand how visitors interact with a website through third-party analytics platforms. They consist of key-value pairs that are specified throughkeyandvalue.

The URL parameter.The parameter can be a custom parameter or a UTM parameter.The supported UTM parameters are:utm_source: The app, site, etc., that brings traffic to your website. For example: TikTok.utm_medium: The advertising or marketing medium. For example: cpm, cpc, banner, and video.utm_content: The creative content used for promotion. For example: ad name, CTA text, asset, and color.utm_campaign: The individual campaign name, slogan, or promo code. For example: BlackFridayProm.Note that UTM parameters are case-sensitive.

The value of the URL parameter.The value can be a custom value or the name of a macro.The supported macros are:__CAMPAIGN_NAME__: This will be replaced by your campaign name.__CAMPAIGN_ID__: This will be replaced by your campaign ID.__AID_NAME__: This will be replaced by your ad group name.__AID__: This will be replaced by your ad group ID.__CID_NAME__: This will be replaced by your ad name.__CID__: This will be replaced by your ad ID.__PLACEMENT__: This will be replaced by your placement.

Click-through window. This attribution window is the time between when a person clicks your ad and then takes an action.Enum values:OFF: Off.ONE_DAY: 1-day click.SEVEN_DAYS: 7-day click.FOURTEEN_DAYS: 14-day click.TWENTY_EIGHT_DAYS: 28-day click.

Engaged view-through window. This attribution window is the time after someone watches at least 6 seconds of your video ad that a conversion is counted.Enum values:ONE_DAY: 1-day engaged view.SEVEN_DAYS: 7-day engaged view.FOURTEEN_DAYS: 14-day engaged view.TWENTY_EIGHT_DAYS: 28-day engaged view.
View-through window. This attribution window is the time between when a person views your ad and then takes an action.Enum values:OFF: Off.ONE_DAY: 1-day view.SEVEN_DAYS: 7-day view.

Event count (Statistic type).The way that people's actions are counted after only viewing or clicking an ad.Enum values:UNSET: Unset.EVERY: Every. To count multiple events from someone as separate conversions.ONCE: Once. To count multiple events from someone as 1 conversion.

Inventory filter tier for the Smart+ Campaign.Enum values:EXPANDED_INVENTORY: Expanded inventory. Your ads will not appear next to explicitly inappropriate content, but they may appear next to content that features mature themes.STANDARD_INVENTORY: Standard inventory. Ad delivery arrangement, in the format of a string that consists of 48 x 7 characters. Each character is mapped to a 30-minute timeframe from Monday to Sunday. Each character can be set to either 0 or 1. 1 represents delivery in the 30-minute timeframe, and 0 stands for non-delivery in the 30-minute timeframe. The first character is mapped to 0:01-0:30 of Monday; The second character is mapped to 0:31-1:00 of Monday, and the last character represents 23:31-0:00 Sunday.Note: Not specified, all-0, or all-1 are considered as full-time delivery.

A list of URL parameters.URL parameters are snippets of code that can be added to the end of the URLs to help you track clicks across different channels and understand how visitors interact with a website through third-party analytics platforms. They consist of key-value pairs that are specified throughkeyandvalue.

The URL parameter.The parameter can be a custom parameter or a UTM parameter.The supported UTM parameters are:utm_source: The app, site, etc., that brings traffic to your website. For example: TikTok.utm_medium: The advertising or marketing medium. For example: cpm, cpc, banner, and video.utm_content: The creative content used for promotion. For example: ad name, CTA text, asset, and color.utm_campaign: The individual campaign name, slogan, or promo code. For example: BlackFridayProm.Note that UTM parameters are case-sensitive.

The value of the URL parameter.The value can be a custom value or the name of a macro.The supported macros are:__CAMPAIGN_NAME__: This will be replaced by your campaign name.__CAMPAIGN_ID__: This will be replaced by your campaign ID.__AID_NAME__: This will be replaced by your ad group name.__AID__: This will be replaced by your ad group ID.__CID_NAME__: This will be replaced by your ad name.__CID__: This will be replaced by your ad ID.__PLACEMENT__: This will be replaced by your placement.

The disclaimer text.Length limit: 90 characters.
Returned whendisclaimer_typeisTEXT_LINK.The clickable disclaimer or clickable disclaimers that you want to add to the ad.
The disclaimer text.Length limit: 40 characters.
The URL for the clickable disclaimer. When users tap each text, they will be redirected to the URL and see more disclaimer details.
The ID of the app that is measured.

Unique identifier for the TikTok video post.You can pass the value of this field totiktok_item_idin/ad/create/to create Spark Ads. To learn more about Spark Ads, seeCreate Spark Ads.Example:6995316737801538821.Updated in: Real-time

An embeddable link for this TikTok video.Example:https://www.tiktok.com/static/profile-video?id=7202758233486822657&hide_author=1&utm_campaign=tt4d_open_api&utm_source=7220548562860376066.Updated in: Real-time

Temporary URL for the video thumbnail.You need to re-acquire the URL after it expires. The expiration time is included in the URL after thex-expiresparameter, in the format of an Epoch/Unix timestamp in seconds.Example:https://p16-sign-va.tiktokcdn.com/tos-maliva-avt-0068/75dec21d63500917fb6ec8bc59415156~c5_300x300.jpeg?x-expires=1614099600&x-signature=PmK%2BWs3LzSzRL2tYs%2FZx7EjG3Gk%3D.Updated in: Real-time
The time when the video was published, in the format of an Epoch/Unix timestamp in seconds (UTC time).Example:1628461703.Updated in: Real-time

Total number of video views for the video.Note:Counts when playback duration >0 and the playback is the first playback in an impression session.If the user swipes away from the ad then swipes back, it would be counted as 2 impressions. Therefore, a new video view will be counted again with the new impression session.Example: 603.Updated in: T + 24-48 hours (UTC time)
Total number of likes on the video.Example: 243.Updated in: T + 24-48 hours (UTC time)
Total number of comments on the video.Example: 10.Updated in: T + 24-48 hours (UTC time)

Total number of times the video has been shared.The share count displayed in this field corresponds to the number of shares shown in the For You feed on the TikTok mobile app. It includes both external shares and internal shares sent to friends using the "Send to friends" button.For example, if a video is shared externally 30 times and shared with friends within the TikTok app 20 times, the value of this field will be 50.Example: 10.Updated in: T + 24-48 hours (UTC time)

Percentage breakdown of the top 10 countries or regions where viewers of the video are located.Max size: 10.Example:[{"country":"CA","percentage":0.0132}, {"country":"GB","percentage":0.0987},{"country":"US","percentage":0.7303},...]Updated in: T + 24-48 hours (UTC time)Note: If thevideo_viewsof the video is less than 100, the value of this field will be an empty list ([]).
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2country code.
Percentage of audience registered from a specified country or region.

Status of the split test.Enum values:UNKNOWN: The status of the split test is unavailable.NOT_STARTED: The split test has not started because thestart_timeof the split test has not arrived yet.IN_PROGRESS: The split test is running.REPORTING_GENERATING: Theend_timeof the split test has passed and a report is being generated.COMPLETED: The split test either ends automatically, or is manually stopped via/split_test/end/.CANCELLED: The split test was canceled before thestart_time. This enum value is only available forcampaign levelsplit test.
Split test level.Enum values:ADGROUP(Ad group level split test.)CAMPAIGN(Campaign level split test.)

Optimization goal of the ad group.For enum values, seeEnumeration - Optimization Goal.
Cell list of the split test.
List ofcampaign_idoradgroup_idin the cell that are associated with the split test.

Split test variable.Enum values:BIDDING_OPTIMIZATION: Set different optimization values for bidding & optimization fields to compare how optimization methods impact your ad performance.TARGTING: Set different targeting values at the ad group level for comparing how effective your ad groups are at reaching different audiences or demographics.CREATIVE: Set different creatives to compare how different creatives impact your ad performance.CUSTOM: Set multiple variables to compare how these variables impact your ad performance. This enum value is only available forcampaign levelsplit test.

The key metric when you created this split test.If no value is specified for this field, the following default values will be used:Forad grouplevel split test, if both ad groups useREACHoptimization goal, the default key metric will beCOST_PER_REACH. Otherwise, the default key metric will beCOST_PER_SHOW.Forcampaign levelsplit test, the default key metric isUNSET.
The start time of this split test, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(ad account time zone).Example:2022-01-01 00:00:00.
The end time of this split test, in the format ofYYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(ad account time zone).Example:2022-01-01 00:00:00.
Test result information.

Metric name.UNSET: Unset.CONVERT_RATE: CVR (Conversion rate).CLICK_THROUGH_RATE: Click through rate (CTR).COST_PER_SHOW: Cost per mille (CPM).COST_PER_CONVERT: Cost per conversion.COST_PER_REACH: Cost per reach.COST_PER_CLICK: Cost per click.COST_PER_FOCUSED_VIEW: Cost per focused view.FOCUSED_VIEW_RATE: Focused view rate.COMPLETE_PAYMENT_ROAS: Complete Payment ROAS.COST_PER_LANDING_PAGE_VIEW: Cost per landing page view.LANDING_PAGE_VIEW_RATE: Landing page view rate.CLICK: Click.REACH: Reach.SHOW: Impression.CONVERT: Conversion.COST: Cost.
P value of each metric. There will be a winning ad group or campaign when the p value <= 0.1.

Average views is the number of times that the video is watched divided by the number of videos,  averaged across the most recent 30 videos.

The ranking of the average number of views per video for the creator's most recent 30 videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's videos are among the top 1% of videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of average views.
Six second views rate is the number of video views that last for at least 6 seconds divided by the total video views, averaged across the most recent 30 videos.

The ranking of the six second views rate for the creator's most recent 30 videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's videos are among the top 1% of videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of six second views rate.
Engagement rate is the number of post engagements (likes, shares, and comments) divided by the total video views, averaged across the most recent 30 videos.

The ranking of the engagement rate for the creator's most recent 30 videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's videos are among the top 1% of videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of engagement rate.

The ranking of the average number of engagements for the creator's most recent 30 videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's videos are among the top 1% of videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of engagement count.
Completion rate is the number of times that a video plays to the end divided by the total video views, averaged across the most recent 30 videos.

The ranking of the video completion rate for the creator's most recent 30 videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's videos are among the top 1% of videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of video completion rate.
Follower growth rate is the increase rate of follower count when compared against the follower count 30 days ago. Not available for new creators with no data 30 days ago.

The ranking of the follower growth rate, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator is among the top 1% of creators on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of follower growth rate.
The average likes over the most recent 30 videos.
The average shares over the most recent 30 videos.
The average comments over the most recent 30 videos.
Information about the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.
The average number of views per video for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.

If the creator's Branded Content videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's Branded Content videos are among the top 1% of Branded Content videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of average views.
The six seconds views rate per video for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.

The ranking of the six seconds views rate for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's Branded Content videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's Branded Content videos are among the top 1% of Branded Content videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of six seconds views rate.
The video completion rate for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.

The ranking of the video completion rate for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. If the creator's Branded Content videos cover multiple topics, the highest ranking among all topics will be displayed.For instance, a value of1.0000means the creator's Branded Content videos are among the top 1% of Branded Content videos on TTCM for that particular topic in terms of video completion rate.
The average shares for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.
The average comments on the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.
The average engagements for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.

The ranking of the average engagements for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos, compared to other TTCM creators with a similar number of followers and covering the same topic. The engagement rate for the creator's most recent 30 Branded Content videos.

The list of industry labels associated with the creator.Creator industry labels are assigned to creators based on the commercial content they produce, including ad creatives and branded content on their TikTok accounts, and represent their commercial experience in certain industries.Note: Creators who no longer have the queried label may still be returned in the results. This is because the label was associated with them at the time the rank was generated. However, these labels can change over time, so a creator might lose a label after the rank has been generated.

Whenranking_typeisBRANDED_CONTENT, this field represents commercial score, which is calculated based on the creator’s experience with commercial content with and the performance of their past commercial content.Whenranking_typeisORGANIC_CONTENT, this field represents follower growth score (an indicator of how quickly the creator’s follower count is growing), which is calculated based on the creator’s follower count growth and video performance within the specified time period.Example: 81.56906666666666.
Follower count.The creator’s current follower count.Example: 242703.

Branded content video views.The total views of all branded content videos, where the video’s branded content toggle was enabled, produced by the Creator within the specified time period.Example: 528377.Note: This field returns a non-null value only whenranking_typeisBRANDED_CONTENTin the request.

Branded content engagement rate.The engagement rate of branded content within the specified time period, calculated as (total number of comments, likes, and shares of branded content) / (total video views).For example, a value of 3.02 means the branded content engagement rate is 3.02%.Note: This field returns a non-null value only whenranking_typeisBRANDED_CONTENTin the request.
Total video views.The total number of views from all of the creator’s videos within the specified time period.Example: 633516.

Engagement rate.The collective engagement rate for all of the creator’s videos during the specified time period. This is calculated as (total number of comments, likes and shares)/(total video views).For example, a value of 2.97 means the branded content engagement rate is 2.97%.
The creator’s starting base price.Example: 30000.Note: If the creator’s starting base pay is not set, the value of this field will be null.
The currency for the creator’s starting base price.Example:USD.Note: If the creator’s starting base pay is not set, the value of this field will be an empty string ("").
The number of followers gained during the specified time period.Example: 180476.Note: This field returns a non-null value only whenranking_typeisORGANIC_CONTENTin the request.
The UTC+0 time when the ranking data was last updated, inISO-8601format.Example:2024-11-19T14:14:22Z.

Ads cost.The estimated total amount of money you've spent on your campaign, ad group, or ad during its schedule.Updated in real time.
Cost per conversion.The average amount of money you've spent on a paid conversion.Updated in real time.
The average amount of money you've spent on a paid click.
The average amount of money you've spent per 1,000 paid impressions.
CTR (destination).The percentage of times people saw your ad and performed a click.Updated in real time.
Conversion rate (CVR).The percentage of conversions from all impressions on your ads.Updated in real time.
Impressions.The number of times your ads were on screen.Updated in real time.
Total views.Total number of times the video has been watched.Updated in real time
Organic video views.Total number of views acquired through organic delivery, and not throughSpark Ads.Updated in real time
Paid views.Total number of views acquired throughSpark Ads.Updated in real time
Reach (Unique viewers).Estimated number of unique users who viewed the video at least once.Updated daily
Engagement count.Total number of likes (likes), shares (shares), and comments (comments).Updated in real time
Engagement rate, calculated as the engagement count (engagement_count) divided by the total number of views (video_views).Updated in real time

Organic engagement rate.The percentage of the audience who interacted with the campaign or video through organic delivery. It is calculated by dividing the number of organic interactions (likes, comments, and shares from non-paid views) by the total number of organic video views.Updated in real time

Paid engagement rate.The percentage of the audience who interacted with the campaign or video through Spark Ads. It is calculated by dividing the number of paid interactions (likes, comments, and shares from paid views) by the total number of paid video views.Updated in real time

Video completion rate, calculated as total completed video views divided by the total number of views (video_views).Updated in real time for the first seven days after the post was created and then updated daily afterwards
Likes.Total number of likes associated with the video.Updated in real time
Organic likes.Total number of likes generated through non-paid (organic) delivery.Updated in real time
Paid likes.Total number of likes generated through Spark Ads.Updated in real time
Comments.Total number of comments associated with the video.Updated in real time
Organic comments.Total number of comments generated through non-paid (organic) delivery.Updated in real time
Paid comments.Total number of comments generated through Spark Ads.Updated in real time
Shares.Total number of shares associated with the video.Updated in real time
Organic shares.Total number of shares generated through non-paid (organic) delivery.Updated in real time
Paid shares.Total number of shares generated through Spark Ads.Updated in real time
Total play time, in seconds.Total amount of time users spend watching the video.Updated in real time for the first seven days after the post was created and then updated daily afterwards

Average view time, in seconds.Average amount of time users spend watching the video, calculated as the total play time (total_play_time) divided by views (video_views).Updated in real time for the first seven days after the post was created and then updated daily afterwards
2-Second video views.Percentage of views that lasted more than two seconds, calculated as the number of views that lasted more than 2 seconds divided by views (video_views).Updated daily
6-Second video views.Percentage of views that lasted more than six seconds, calculated as the number of views that lasted more than six seconds divided by views (video_views).Updated daily

A list of numbers indicating the video retention rate at each second.For instance, the value[1, 0.61, 0.27, 0.2, 0.16, 0.14, 0.11, 0.09, 0.08, 0.07, 0.07, 0.06, 0.05, 0.05, 0.05, 0.04, 0.04]indicates that during the first second, the video retention rate decreases from 100% to 61%.Updated in real time for the first seven days after the post was created and then updated daily afterwards
View sources.Breakdown of how viewers were exposed to the video.Updated in real time for the first seven days after the post was created and then updated daily afterwards

The status of VBO for Web or VBO IAP for App for the settings in the request.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any value.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but you are not allowlisted to use the allowlist-only feature specified through the settings.

The status of the Cost Cap bidding strategy for the settings in the request when VBO for Web or VBO IAP for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any value.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but you are not allowlisted to use the allowlist-only feature specified through the settings.Note: The Cost Cap bidding strategy is no longer supported for VBO. Therefore, the value of this field is alwaysNOT_SUPPORT.

The status of the bidding strategy Minimum ROAS for the settings in the request when VBO  for Web or VBO IAP for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any value.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but you are not allowlisted to use the allowlist-only feature specified through the settings.

The status of the bidding strategy Highest Value for the settings in the request when VBO for Web or VBO IAP for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated any value.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the pixel (pixel_id) or App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but you are not allowlisted to use the allowlist-only feature specified through the settings.

The status of the Day 7 bidding strategy Minimum ROAS (Day 7 ROAS) for the settings in the request when VBO IAA for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any events with a conversion value greater than 0.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events with a conversion value greater than 0.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but the App (app_id) has not met the unlocking criteria for the feature.

The status of the Day 7 bidding strategy Highest Value (Day 7 Highest Value) for the settings in the request when VBO IAA for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any events with a conversion value greater than 0.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events with a conversion value greater than 0.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but the App (app_id) has not met the unlocking criteria for the feature.

The status of the Day 0 bidding strategy Minimum ROAS (Day 0 ROAS) for the settings in the request when VBO IAA for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any events with a conversion value greater than 0.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events with a conversion value greater than 0.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but the advertiser (advertiser_id) has not been allowlisted for day 0 bidding of VBO IAA.

The status of the Day 0 bidding strategy Highest Value (Day 0 Highest Value) for the settings in the request when VBO IAA for App is enabled.Enum values:QUALIFIED: Eligible.NO_EVENT: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any event.NO_VALUE: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated any events with a conversion value greater than 0.INSUFFICIENT_EVENTS: Not eligible because the App (app_id) has not accumulated enough events with a conversion value greater than 0.NOT_SUPPORT: Not eligible for any of the following reasons:The settings are not supported.The settings are supported, but the advertiser (advertiser_id) has not been allowlisted for day 0 bidding of VBO IAA.

Returned only when you've set bothflaw_detectandauto_fix_enabledtotruein request, and video issues are detected.Fix task ID.To obtain the fixed video, you can use one of the following methods:Pass the value of this field to thetask_idfield in/video/fix/task/get/.Retrieve the fixed video from/file/video/ad/search/if you have setauto_bind_enabledtotruein the request.

Returned only when you've set bothflaw_detectandauto_fix_enabledtotruein request, and video issues are detected.Video issue types.Enum values:LOW_RESOLUTION: Video resolution is lower than 540x960 px, which doesn't meet our requirements.ILLEGAL_VIDEO_SIZE: The video size is not correct. Use the standard video size: Square (1:1) / Vertical (9:16) / Horizontal (16:9).NO_BGM(deprecated): The ad or video has no background audio, or the background audio is incoherent/unclear.BLACK_EDGE(deprecated) :  A video image contains black bars, which affects user experience and is not allowed.ILLEGAL_DURATION(deprecated): Video length is either longer than 60s or shorter than 5s, which doesn't meet our requirements.
